history.content:
I'm a hopeful datascience or CS major, and Math 1b is absolutely destroying me. I think at best I'd be able to end up with a B-, maybe a B if im lucky.

My other CS classes (data 8 and cs88) are going pretty well and I'm on track to get an A- or better in them, but Math 1b is absolutely soul crushing -- I really underestimated its time commitment and learned a lot from my stupid mistakes.

Would I be fine if I just P/NP'd so I can focus more on my other classes and not have my GPA destroyed? I would then be taking it at my local community college this summer.

To my understanding, a lot of people I know skipped out of 1b due to taking it at CC or AP'ing out of it, so I'm not really sure if it would be that big of a deal to not get a letter grade for it at Berkeley. I know if I take it at CC the grade won't transfer over to benefit my GPA.
history.subject: Can I P/NP Math1B and take it at a community college this summer instead?
